title: Antfin Singapore to sell Zomato shares worth $408 million via block deal: Report
description: Antfin currently holds 4.3% stake in the food delivery platform. At the floor price, the shares will be available for sale at a discount of 4.6% over Monday’s closing price of Rs 263.24 on the NSE. Zomato's shares rose 6% intraday following UBS's target price hike. The company posted a substantial increase in profit and revenue for the June quarter, doubling its market capitalization in 2024.
content: Antfin Singapore will likely sell shares in Zomato worth $408 million at floor price of Rs 251.68 per share via block deal, ET Now reported quoting agencies. It currently holds 4.3% stake in the food delivery platform. At this price, the shares will be available for sale at a discount of 4.6% over Monday’s closing price of Rs 263.24 on the NSE. Zomato shares on Monday ended down by Rs 1.2 or 0.45% over Friday’s closing price after hitting a lifetime high of Rs 280.90.It is a developing story and more information on this is awaited. Zomato shares jumped 6% on Monday on the intraday basis following a raise in target price by global brokerage firm UBS from Rs 260 to Rs 320."We increase our GMV estimates for food delivery (+2-3%) and quick commerce (+20-30%) for FY26-28e following the strong Q1 and solid guidance. Our adj EBITDA estimates for the next 1-2 years are up only slightly as investments in building supply for quick commerce will likely result in a more modest margin trajectory," UBS said in a note while maintaining buy call.
